script:
1.3
foxBox (foxUnit01)
http://www.memes.no/88flak/
THIS IS AN OPTIONAL PATCH, AND DOES NOT NEED TO BE ACTIVATED UNLESS YOU WANT THE DESIRED EFFECT FROM THE PATCH. Activate this AFTER activating Flak. Ignore FLMM's "incompatible" error messages.
This is the 88 Flak AI Companion Bot, a go-anywhere-with-you shoot-only-your-enemies bot companion. It is aimed at providing the lone Flak player a little compensation for any lack of a real comrade.
While the bots will accompany you in-betwen systems, note that the bots will form on you in odd spots when you fly into another system. This can be worked around by simply using "Select New Character" under the F1 menu to log out and back in every time you jump systems. Or, just land on a base, and that fixes it too.
Please refer to the AI Companion Bot FAQ in the 88 Flak Readme for more details. However, here's a short summation of the AI Companion Bot:
Pros: + An AI companion (or squad of companions) that will accompany you where-ever your travels take you. You may also choose what your bots attack. + A selection of bots to choose from, ranging from fighters to battleships. Each bot has its own unique name and ship loadout. + The ability to create your own bots (view AI Companion Bot FAQ in the 88 Flak readme for more info) + Enhanced AI for the bots - a single bot can easily mow down several NPCs, much like how a player could. + Bots require no money to assist the player - simply fly around, the bots will 'find' you, and offer assistance / follow you, like wingmen. + They follow you through EVERY system. + The bots are designed to work for co-operative play with a friend (or friends), however players that are further than 20Km from another player will receive a bot squad of their own - so to keep things fair, it is advised that players stick close together.
Cons: - Bots have a tendancy to take a little bit of time to 'find' the player after the player launches from a base, jumps systems, or logs in. There isn't a really reliable method to solve this; however, just fly around in the area you lauched / jumped / logged into, or just start travelling to your destination. Either way, the bots will eventually come to your position. - You can not hire wingmen while bots are with you. FL only allows one NPC wing at a time on a player, and the bots currently take up that position.
The AI Companion is BETA. Although a lot of testing has gone into it, and it works pretty well, the AI Companion still has quite a few kinks to be worked out (as mentioned above).
This will not work with normal Freelancer.
;Padding Start
scan_chance = 0.999999
scan_chance = 0.000000 ;Changed by AI Bot FLMM Script
;npc_ship = follow_ship ;Bot activation needed by FLMM, not by hand
npc_ship = follow_ship ;Bots activated
;Padding End
